title: Odin Space raises $3 million in seed funding
key_assets: ['tiny sensors for sub-centimeter orbital debris mapping', 'Nano Sensors']
summary: British startup Odin Space raised $3 million in a seed funding round to commercialize its tiny sensors designed to map and analyze sub-centimeter orbital debris. The company demonstrated its technology in 2023 using D-Orbit’s ION orbital transfer vehicle and plans to launch its first commercial Nano Sensors in 2026.
why_it_matters: Odin Space’s technology addresses a critical gap in tracking lethal, non-trackable debris, which could reduce satellite insurance costs and improve orbital safety for commercial and military satellites.
relevance_reason: Target company not mentioned in summary
